The human population could increase significantly due to the elimination of food-related illnesses and the reduction in resources required for agriculture.
People could have more time and energy to focus on other pursuits, such as education, art, and science.
The food industry could collapse, leading to a shift in the economy and new forms of employment.
There could be a decrease in the amount of land used for agriculture, leading to deforestation and environmental conservation efforts.
People could develop new ways of obtaining nutrients, such as through supplements or synthetic food substitutes.
